website_summaries.verdict: A smaller version of the environmentally friendly No-Spill gas can.
pros: At just 1.25-gallons, this size is lightweight and easy to carry around
This model is a good size for gas-oil mixes
A viewing window helps you see how much gas is in the can
Has a button to control the flow
Good track record of controlling leaks
cons: Does not seem to have the longevity of other models

customer_reviews.title: Easy removal of child proof cap protector
customer_reviews.text: Like "no-spill" can. Hate the child proof-knuckle buster cap! Here is how I very easily removed it. Use nippers (dikes) and snip it off. See before and after photos.
customer_reviews.author: Wordchaser

customer_reviews.title: The "no spill" is only true for a brief period of time...
customer_reviews.text: After one summer of very light use this can has started leaking. When you release the button (the whole reason you buy this can) the fuel continues to come out at a decent, small pace. I've talked to a couple of dock mates that have had similar experiences with this style can. It might still be better than dealing with the non-vented fuel cans but I'm a little disappointed that it only worked "as advertised" for a very short summer...
customer_reviews.author: J. Stee

customer_reviews.title: One of the better "Save you from yourself" spout designs
customer_reviews.text: Most, if not all, of the new spout designs that meet government safety regulations for dispensing gas are cumbersome to use and, in my experience, potentially more dangerous than the old simple open spouts. At least this one is relatively easy to adapt to use and uses an o-ring seal that is set into the spout so that it seals without over-tightening and inevitable leaking by distortion. Since it is now the law that gas "cans" have to be equipped with these safety spouts, this one is a good choice among those on the market. I could not find a design I liked better at any of the local hardware stores, big or small.
customer_reviews.author: estbrandt

customer_reviews.title: Collapse in on itself.
customer_reviews.text: I did like this this gas can when I first got it. However, after a few hot days I opened my shed to find a very strong fuel odor and found the fuel can had sucked in on itself causing fuel to escape. The fuel tank is permanently damaged and can no longer be filled with gas. This needs some sort of ventilation to prevent this from happening. Only filled one time, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann M

customer_reviews.title: Well built poorly designed.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the gas can a lot until it sat in the back of my SUV while I was cutting wood. The pressure in the container increased with the car's temperature, when I refilled my chainsaw fuel rushed out of the pressurized container so fast it that in less than a second my chainsaw was full, my clothes were soaked and I had 2 stroke fuel in my eye. Well built but I have to say that because it won't relieve pressure it is poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one step filling
customer_reviews.text: I miss the gasoline cans which had dual openings, a spout a one side and a vent on the other. Nothing easier. That being said a finally found a single opening can which is easy to use. Many of these new "safety cans" are a nightmare to pour gasoline from. Press this lever, push that valve, pry this thing against that thing, etc.. You need three hands to operate them and the gas spills everywhere. So much for safety. With this can I use only one hand and with my thumb, on the same hand, push down on the button and out comes the gasoline. For me, the no spill part is just an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: L. O.

customer_reviews.title: First gas can not to bring out my inner Hulk in three years
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, a gas can that the government has approved that doesn’t require another person to operate. Used as a spare gas can on a small sailboat. I really do like the ability to turn the dispenser so easily and the thumb button made it very easy to dispense. Refueling on a boat in the water is always worrying because even a little spill in the water can be too much, but this is the best little can I’ve used so far and felt safer using it on the water than most others.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Great way to spill gas everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I was sold on the videos, but it was a total disaster. This thing just leaks gas out of the upper contraption every time I try to use it. I finally had to just give up and dump from the jug into another container using a funnel so the fuel inside didn't all go to waste.
customer_reviews.author: A. Partridge

customer_reviews.title: Like the safety design minus the o-seal on threaded collar
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact there is a spark arrester in the can and the nozzle is a good design, but I have one major concern. I screwed the collar on the can and the seal was in place but when I tipped the can fuel leaked out at a good rate. I tightened it more and it still leaked. After that I unscrewed the collar and inspected the o-ring. It seemed to be slightly deformed; perhaps by overtightening, but not sure. I screwed the collar on a third time and it seems to be ok now. It would be nice if the seal was more of a flat rubber seal instead of an o-ring.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: You know these are nice cans and they function well with a minor exception. When you put the spout in the opening and press the plunger, if you don't (or cannot) put it in far enough you have to watch it carefully to make sure it doesn't overflow. Aside from that they work well and are worth the price. Easy to lift and pour. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: DS1947

customer_reviews.title: OVERFLOW when filling LEAKING GAS EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: This thing cannot be filled up without spilling and stopping the pump every time, wasting my money and ensuring maximum gas spillage and embarrassment in front of everyone while I take 4 times as long and look as stupid as possible while doing it. Am I really expected to fill a different gasoline container and then fill this container from that container or something? WTF?!? I seriously can't believe this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: You have to vent the can or it will crack open
customer_reviews.text: It works well but if you keep gas in it all the time it will expand and contract with the hot and cold weather conditions. It has cracked open at the bottom of the can and I have gas all over the floor of my shop I have to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: allen jasper manning

customer_reviews.title: Best Overall Gas Cans & Dispenser Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I have had so many different gas cans over the years and with the horrible gas spouts that have been coming out recently, I decided to research what others have found to be a good solution. Here it is, these are amazing! Purchased two 1.25 gallon cans (one for 2-stroke/mix), and a 5 gallon can. I use my old cans for storage now, and transfer gas from those to these when these run low. The auto shutoff works nice, but you do need to still keep an eye on the level and probably shut it off manually rather than completely relying on the auto shutoff, but still works nice.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Davis

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work as shown in the video. The button is hard to depress and it doesn't stop automatically as shown in the video. The first time I used it to fill my mower gas spilled out all over my garage.
customer_reviews.author: ncpapa

customer_reviews.title: Works great, spillproof!
customer_reviews.text: Skeptical at first, but after reading a lot of reviews on different spillproof gas cans, I decided to go with this one. It has worked out great so far, no spills. I use it for filling the lawnmower and it's worked great. The container itself feels pretty solid, material seems thick. One tip is to vent the can/spout first before filling as gases do seem to build pressure in the can. Feels secure and I'm not as apprehensive about it spilling or venting in the car on my way home! No issues so far, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Needed a smaller gas can to mix oil and gas for a 2-Cycle engine
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Stihl backpack leaf blower (which is awesome) and needed another gas tank for the gas/oil mixture for the 2-cycle engine. The oil I purchased had a mix of one bottle per one gallon of gas. This 1-1/4 gallon can worked perfectly for that. The pour spout with push button nozzle works every time without spills. I have another larger No-Spill gas can that I use for other gas powered equipment and it has worked perfectly for years. Hoping to get many years out of this can. I would purchase again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Time

customer_reviews.title: Worthless. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it well enough when I first got it. I was storing gas/oil mix in it for my chain saws. I looked at it recently and it was all distorted. It is now a throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy Bear

customer_reviews.title: Nice small gas can.
customer_reviews.text: Very thick plastic construction is a plus. Has fire suppression screen included. Clear area allows you to see how full can is when filling. Bought for safety stop feature. This works well when filling larger things like lawn mowers or power washers but not as well with small things like chain saws or weed eaters. Easy to control due to push button filling which makes up for auto stop feature when using with small gas power tools. Overall nice small gas can with nice features.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: BUY NO OTHER TANK BUT THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.text: Since you can only get one of these new "safety" (NOT) filler spouts, this is THE one to get. Takes two hands (one to hold the tank handle, & one to squeeze the "open" trigger), but works, is reliable, controlable, it doesn't spill, runs fast, and stops when your tank is full. Do not waste your time and money on any of those other filler nozzle contraptions that only make a mess, dribble fuel, break, or don't work and just make you mad. Buy this one! And no, I don't work for this company, didn't get mine free from them, or derive any other benefit other than the joy of complimenting a great design.
customer_reviews.author: R Thomas

customer_reviews.title: IT DOSE SPILLS
customer_reviews.text: It does NOT work as been advertised. It doesn’t shots off by it self like been advertised. It is only work manually as on and off switch It does SPIL. Is not worth the money. I won’t recommend it for this price.
customer_reviews.author: GKA

customer_reviews.title: Over payed for what I got!
customer_reviews.text: The one I received does not automatically shut off. I was expecting it to. It is overpriced for that reason alone. Hate to pay this much and not have it work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Ilovelight

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY. DEFECTIVE PRODUCT. SPILLS GAS EVERYWHERE.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! Constantly leaks and overfills the gas tank you are trying to fill despite following all of the instructions and getting the cap as tight as possible. Does not work as advertised in the video. Literally does not do anything it is advertised to do. Unfortunately, I purchased the product in the fall for a snowblower, so I am outside of the return window. Going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: So with the pressure changes, seal is so good there's either a vacuum in there or it bloats up. Either way does what it's supposeb to, when in use or when in transport. Perfect for the mower. I have a huge yard with a push mower. Filled it several times and I still have about 2 fill ups left after only buying a gallon and some change. Threw it around to test it, nothing broke yet... either way good buy. Needed one anyways that doesn't have a stupid push tab that clings onto the rim of the gas tank or pull tube. The Button is perfect .
customer_reviews.author: Redbear1

customer_reviews.title: Crazy good
customer_reviews.text: This is the finest gas container I have ever used in my life. Watch the video – it does exactly what they claim. I use this to fill a chainsaw and I don’t spill a drop - ever. The first time I used it - I held the nozzle up a little and got an overflow. Then I realized I was doing it wrong (operator error). Put the nozzle all the way in what you are filling - and you get repeatable, consistent results every time - full - with zero spillage. This far exceeds any other gas can I have ever used – and trust me, I have used MANY. This is literally the best.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't leak and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a leaf blower that uses 2-stroke. This container is perfect for mixing in the oil and is so easy to use without spilling any gas. To release gas you have to press a button and when you are done, release the button and the container is sealed - very helpful. It is a little more expensive but when you consider the smell and mess caused by a spill it's well worth the small extra amount. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pughimag

customer_reviews.title: easy to dispense ? 2 stars  it leaks all over
customer_reviews.text: i already owned two of these with no problems . DO NOT BUY THESE - they leak . upon using it FOR THE VERY FIRST TIME gas spilt all over the tank of my brand new motorcycle .AND when i tried to return them --SEE OUR RETURN POLICY -- NON - RETURNABLE . WHAT ? VERY BAD MOVE AMAZON - I spend literally thousands of dollars each year ..... hello !! walmart!!!
customer_reviews.author: ROGER ROCKET 3

customer_reviews.title: Great and handy product
customer_reviews.text: Solid tank. I like the see through gauge on the end. I thought it was kind of gimmicky but actually, it's pretty neat to have. My cans are stored about head level on the top of a garage cabinet so I like knowing as I pick it up if it is almost empty. Also kind of neat because I can do a quick check from across the garage when I am running errands out by the non-ethanol gas station to see if I need a few gallons to top off either of my two tanks. No sold on the "NO SPILL" part though--mine still overflow.
customer_reviews.author: Bmcgnh

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Of all the gas cans, of newer no vent, I have ever used these No-Spill brand are absolutely the best. Easy to fill. Lid screws on tight, no leaks. The valve on top for pouring is easy to use. The valve makes it really hard for you to spill the gas. Not that you can't spill gas but basically you put nozzle into what you're filling, tip can and press button. I highly recommend these cans. 👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: E. A. C.

customer_reviews.title: The worst.
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst gas can I have ever owned & I've owned quite a few. It leaks when you pour the gas into a machine no matter how tight you get the pour spout tightened.
customer_reviews.author: William Shedaker

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good gas can. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is the unit doesn't always work for me. The majority of the time the auto shutoff works, but there have been times where the fuel keeps coming out. It's most likely user error. I've tried a lot of gas cans, since the Blitz is no longer being made, and this is one of the better ones. That being said, I've also spent a lot of money, trying to find "that" one. In hindsight, I should've just spent the extra money on a type II gas can such as Eagle or Justrite, and be done with it. Those are much safer gas cans anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: on 2 units the black cap has split within 12-18 months and your gas can is useless. You can't fix this split in the plastic
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 of these in various sizes. The flow and application is exactly what is advertised however, on 2 units the black cap has split within 12-18 months and your gas can is useless. You can't fix this split in the plastic. I do note that you can reorder the poor assembly, but if you figure you will need one about every 18 months, the whole things get cost prohibitive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping small amount of gas around house.
customer_reviews.text: I have several two cycle gas things that I needed to keep gas for. Chain saw. Two cycle lawn mower. Two cycle string trimmer. I only buy one gallon of gas at a time. This can is perfect. I love the dispensor. In the past, using a 2 1/2 gallon can, I almost over filled everything when filling. I find it much easier to fill thing up without over filling now.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Stupid design
customer_reviews.text: It works, I guess. I think all gas cans are now made this style. The tip is hard plastic and can't be bent into shape. For example, if you are pouring into a vehicle, you have to get creative and you won't be able to pour all gas into your car with the angle and room needed. I ended up spilling more gas than I would have with the old design.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: After a week, I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: First, I wanted to hate this. My go-to gas can of 22 years old, needed to be replace. I'm that guy that puts vents in any ventless can. This carb compliant VENT-LESS had the best reviews, so I bought it. - I did remove the little ring lock, that is supposed to keep the spout attached. Other than that, it seals and dispenses gas better than expected. This is a small can that I use for small engines. (My large cans, I still have vents on, as I need to get gallons out in a timely fashion.) Unknown how long it will hold up, but I did NOT install a vent. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a lemon but mine lasted less than  year
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shape of it. I was perfectly happy until the seem on top under the handler split and started leaking. I’ve never had a gas can like this leak and I’ve been all kinds of hard on them. This one was babied, I kept it in the trunk of my Cadillac. So I’m really irritated that in less than a year I have no can.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Blair

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this gas can
customer_reviews.text: With all the new safety requirements imposed on gas can these, by far, are the easiest to use. I really appreciate the nozzle mechanism's ease of use. The other predominate style that requires you to press the nozzle mechanism against the lip on a fuel tank are difficult to use. I think that style also puts too much pressure on the fuel tank that will lead to latter problems. Definitely recommend this gas can.
customer_reviews.author: T. West

customer_reviews.title: Is it more than No-Spill.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gas can. I use it for pre-mix for my lawn equipment. I can shake the can vigorously and nothing leaks. Using the push button control I can accurately dispense small amounts of gas without overfilling my lawn equipment tanks. The push button control shuts off the flow quickly and completely when released. The nozzle cover keeps the dispensing nozzle clean to reduce chance of dirt getting into the tanks.
customer_reviews.author: K. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Rather Expensive, But Works Quite Well
customer_reviews.text: The last gas can I bought in the 90s cost about $5.00. I was shocked at how expensive they've become, but I suppose it's due to the fancy no-spill spigot. I must admit it works well for controlling the flow of gas, and removes the need to unscrew the cap to install the spout for each use. That makes it much more convenient to use and greatly reduces (though doesn't totally eliminate) spillage. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: boingo of the oing

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gas container. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m really happy with this. It works as advertised and seems to be very well constructed. I will warn you to not make the same dumb mistake I did...they chose to make the cap on the tip the same color as the spout. So if you’re an idiot like me and don’t realize that and remove it, your pour is NOT “no spill”. That’s clearly a “user error” but just warning you. Might want to color the tip with a marker or something. But other than that, my experience with it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Arok5

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Still Be Careful With Fuel
customer_reviews.text: I really don't see what the problem is that some have working a simple container. I have no trouble with the nozzle attachment to the container or fueling from the can without spilling a drop. This is the third one I own, I keep my 4-cycle mower and 2-cycle mixed blower fuel separate. If you want a no spill container this is as close as it gets, it will not replace being careful with fuel or make up for carelessness
customer_reviews.author: James - Oneof6

customer_reviews.title: best tanks for 15 years: modern vapor/pour safety, as easy to pour as tanks before safety features
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tanks I've used for 15 years. They have modern vapor/porr safety, and they pour as easy as old style tanks. The spout is turned on and off by a thumb button at the back of the spout. It is easy to find with your thumb, and turns the spout on and off immediate without any spill or wait time for the spout to drain.
customer_reviews.author: Bonaventura

customer_reviews.title: Probably best for EPA friendly cans
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of complaints on these EPA cans on the internet and found this one to be one of the best rated. This can does work great, I haven’t spilled and it actually works better than my old non epa ones. Only modification I did was I got rid of the child safety lock. It was super overly aggressive to take off when filling at the pump. So I cut them off the 2 cans I bought. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Williamson Sr.

customer_reviews.title: No Spill Is Correct
customer_reviews.text: It say's right on the can " No Spill " and that's definitely what you get , it doesn't spill at all !! This can is the best I have ever owned , no more wasted gasoline on the ground , the push button makes all the difference , you control the flow with your thumb , what could be more easier than that ? I am one satisfied customer and I highly recommend these gas cans , Thank You Very Much !!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel W. Racanelli

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve!
customer_reviews.text: Filled it up the today as soon as I received it. It POURED gas all over my camping generator. Not dripped....POURED! I had so removed the main cap and fill using a funnel instead.
customer_reviews.author: S. HYANS

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This product does not need a vent as it pours smoothly. Having to depress the EPA mandated button is a little inconvenient, thanks to an increasingly infantile society, whose litigations at every turn has our government forcing manufacturers to make idiot-proof products. I expect in the future the EPA will require these product to come with a nanny.
customer_reviews.author: Djard

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Does it work as intended, YES. And that is why I gave 3 stars. It is not the manufacturers fault, but it is very difficult to use, to the point where I would not buy anything much larger than the 1-1/4 capacity can. Federal law requires you have to hold down the knob while pouring. It also has twist lock features when opening and closing, can be difficult to manage for anyone with weaker hands. Again, I know it is federal law that requires these security features, but something so simple has now become so difficult to do. I would recommend buying the older used cans if you have the opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: scally

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.  Still spills gas
customer_reviews.text: Does not shut of gas automatically. That was the reason that I picked this. (bought 2 cans both do it). But, I do like that I can see the level of gas in the can with just normal room light. I need to learn from this. I looked at the number of positive reviews and bought it. Not going to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: janetplanetz

customer_reviews.title: It worked as advertised for one season, which consisted ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked as advertised for one season, which consisted of one week of actual use. Today the green button wouldn't push in to release the gas. I finally forced it. The button then released the gas, but allowed a dribble of gas to come out when the button was not in. This is a danger if the can now tips, the gas will leak out.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: 25 gallon version and I'm very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but I bought it based on the comments of other Amazon customers. I am impressed with this gas can. I have had 50:1 chainsaw fuel in it for over 2 months and zero smell, no fumes, and the pour spout mechanism works very well and no leaks. I have the 1.25 gallon version and I'm very pleased with it. Why 4 stars? Because of all of the ridiculous "safety" things on the can which makes it somewhat difficult to get it open to fill it. You can cut those parts off. I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: myra

customer_reviews.title: collapse in on itself
customer_reviews.text: This can collapsed in on itself at the first use after I filled the gas and put it in my SUV. It was Spring time. The outside temperature was just 50F. When I came back and read the review, I found other people had the similar issue. The can can be broken due to the pressure. Don't use it unless you fill the gas and pour it out right away.
customer_reviews.author: robin tang

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas Can Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Oh. My. Gosh! As a total klutz who’s never been able to use those plastic gas cans with notched the green collar, I can’t tell you how much I love my new no-spill can. No more wasted gas or gas on my hands from an overfilled tank. No more unladylike swearing as I fight to steady the lawn mower with my foot so I can use both hands on the gas can. This no-spill can is possibly the best thing ever. Better even than a well-made PB&J.
customer_reviews.author: KathyD

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use. Vs other safety type spouts.
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s bren simple to use but the auto shut off feature did not work when filling my weed trimmer. Maybe nozzle has to be further into tank but gas hole is small and it doesn’t go in far due to opening size gas hole and flare of gas spout. Or I may have a defective spout. Still works simple enough and now I just have to shut off manually and not depend on auto shutoff like in video.
customer_reviews.author: Rx4speed

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST - EASIEST - DISPENSING I'VE EXPERIENCED
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A FEW GAS CANS. MOTORCYCLE. BOAT. GOLF CART. AND I'VE COME TO HATE THE SAFETY DEVICES ON MOST GAS CANS. IN THE PAST - SPILLED ALL OVER ME. THIS ONE IS AWESOME!!!!! WISH YOU SOLD JUST THE DISPENSING TOP - FOR ME TO PUT ON THE OTHER TANKS I BOUGHT FROM A) LOWES AND B) HOME DEPOT!
customer_reviews.author: DaveIndy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: If, after you fill your gas can, you have to drive 9mi to your home in a car as I do, this is the perfect gas can to purchase. That is why after purchasing one, I was so happy I went ahead and purchased a second one for my lawn equipment that requires the oil mixed in with gasoline. This is also a perfect gas can for filling up the tank without a drop of spillage.
customer_reviews.author: Mary P

customer_reviews.title: Hard pass!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this CA approved gas can but this is what happened when keeping it in the shed. What a waste of money. Too late for a return 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use!  Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to use. Like that you can see the gas inside through the see-through window. The measurement lines are closer to the corner. Would be easier to use if they were directly over-or-beside the clear window, but good enough and would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B from VA

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas Can I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why the federal government stepped in and complicated the gas can design (I know add safety)- but all models I could find at the local stores now requiring you to push the edge of the spout on the gas can which I am not a fan of. This model is the best gas can I have had (including any old models without the safety features). The push button allows me to get the spout into position and control the start and stop of the flow. I have not tried the feature that auto-shuts off the flow when the level reaches the spout as the push button allows me easy control to not need that. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: NKC, MO

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gas can
customer_reviews.text: Death to those government mandated push down to open spill every time gas lids. This one really works. Love it. The first time I had to unscrew the lid, I immediately broke off the jagged teeth to make it child proof by bending it back with my thumb. Wiggle it a few times and it comes off or use dykes. Don't need a nanny jaw on my gas can. No problems with the treads, twist tight for no spill. Oh and it pours fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kilimanjaro

customer_reviews.title: Great can for support lawn equipment
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't leak and is super easy to use, which is hard to say for the dozens of other devices on the market. 1 gallon of gas, one unit of oil, a shot of stabil, and we're off to the races. Great purchase, should have bought one sooner. It's also very maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This is not only better than those horrid terrible CARB cans where you have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those very very rare products that really honestly works well. This is not only better than those horrid terrible CARB cans where you have to push down on the little tap in the spout to pour, it's actually way better than even the standard old jerry cans. I use these for topping up the built in tank on my outboard while on the water. Not a drop spilled. Had one for 2 years and recently bought a second. Really--this works GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: No more spills.
customer_reviews.text: Best gas can made. So easy to use. Perfect for filling small tanks on chainsaws, weed eaters, trimmers and such. Just push button with thumb and fill, release button and filling stops immediately. No spilling. The only had can i will use. I own four if them.
customer_reviews.author: PMdoit

customer_reviews.title: Great gas can but too small
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought the next size up. I bought it for the lawn mower. I don't mow my lawn every week but if I did I'd be running to the gas station a lot! Also if you forget to take off the cap and try to dispense gas....it will leak. This has happened a couple times...lol...but I mostly chalk that up to user error!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: It lets you pour gas into your mower or Snow Blower without spilling it all over due to that terrible invent someone cam of with for spouts on most gas cans. Very high-quality product. Easy to use and my wife loves it. Amazon Prime sent it out right away!
customer_reviews.author: Keith S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Non-Spill Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a new gas can for his chainsaw. He came across this and decided he needed another one for his weedwacker. After reading the reviews on this product I was so impressed so I bought one for my brother and brother-in-law. If you’ve ever used a gascan and never spilt a drop on yourself you got some mad skills but if you ever had this can will give you mad skills no matter how much or little you need.
customer_reviews.author: 911momma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. I recommend this product. / disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gasoline container. Wanted to order another one, the 2 gallon, but for what ever reason they don't ship to Puerto Rico. Filling up my generator is easy and without having to clean up afterwards. Update: Suddenly the shut off on the canister isn't working any longer, which is very dissapointing. I had high hopes for this product. I will deduct 3 stars, as this was the feature for which it was advertised and I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Better Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: No more spills when gassing up your small engines. Changes size and shape with temperature but hasn't leaked. Very easy to dispense small amounts to small engines. Ergonomic. Cannot dispense to vehicle, however, without using intermediary gas can.
customer_reviews.author: Conflicted Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: After my fourth cheap "safety" gas can (with the spring-loaded spout) which leaked fuel everywhere failed, I decided to try one of these. I now own four of these. They are very high quality, fill your machines quickly, and have a low center of gravity. I haven't spilled a single drop of fuel using these. They are pricey, but very well made and hassle-free. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Finally a frustration-free gas can!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a gas can that doesn’t cause frustration and leak gas everywhere! I hate the new gas cans with their supposed safety features - they are more unsafe because you end up getting gas everywhere trying to operate their safety rigged spout! This can is great and simple. Thank You!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazon2

customer_reviews.title: Great little gas can.
customer_reviews.text: Great little gas can. It takes a little bit of using it to be able to use it as the video shows. I also bought the extension for it for use on the equipment where it’s awkward using the short spout. I also followed the advice given in a prior review and marked the one gallon line with a black permanent marker so it’s easier to see since fuel mixtures are usually for one gallon. The only con would be the cost of the cans which is preventing me from buying the larger cans.
customer_reviews.author: Clay R Burton

customer_reviews.title: BEST buy for BEST SAFTY STORAGE
customer_reviews.text: This is my second gas can because of the features it has, easy to handle @1&1/2 gal.of gas. The spring on the spout is a little stiff to hold while pouring, I'm getting in my years so my strength isn't there. Well made a bit pricey, but most are these days with special feachers.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis V.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I’m using it correctly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been filling gas into cars,mower,go carts and lawn equipment since I was knee high. Always seem to over flow the small gas tanks so when I seen this, I was stoked! Save your money. I still over flow the mower when it’s suppose to stop.
customer_reviews.author: OldSchoolWatcher

customer_reviews.title: EASY to handle gas can - the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have to keep gas on hand for my generator, but can't handle larger containers. I had 2-gallon No-Spill cans, and still do, but wanted something a little "less" to handle. I know No-Spill really are the best, so I was very pleased to find these 1.25 gallon No-Spills! They are easy to handle, easy to refill, easy to store. I HIGHLY recommend all the No-Spill line.
customer_reviews.author: LittleTank

customer_reviews.title: Best can I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I’ve held onto my old gas cans (pre-government in my tool shed) forever and my mix-gas can finally wore out. I was very hesitant to spend the comparatively high price for this can but so very glad I did, I could not be more please. Very easy to fill hand-held yard tools without spilling a drop; HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a gas can that is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: When new safety regulations came out a few years ago to prevent accidental spills, it seemed designers did their best to frustrate customers. This gas can has a simple premise, push the button and gas comes out. It works as well as this statement sounds. Great gas can.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal F Keeling

customer_reviews.title: No more gasoline smelling hands
customer_reviews.text: No expert but I've tried different spill proof nozzles before and they all were worthless in my opinion so now I finally found one that does what it says. Oh a gardening shop turn me on to this and they fill their gas powered tools daily
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anthony Dean

customer_reviews.title: don't forget the cap!
customer_reviews.text: The spout has a plastic cap on the end that is the same color as the spout. If you forget to remove it, gas will spew out from under it. This has happened to me twice already. Other than that, it dispenses great and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mangiapane

customer_reviews.title: Oh was I glad once I found this product
customer_reviews.text: Oh was I glad once I found this product. I first bought a briggs gas can that spilled half the fuel all over the floor. These gas cans don't and are extremely easy to use. Just push the button to open the nozzle and gas flows. Stop pressing the button and the gas stops flowing. Sounds simple enough but many gas cans these days come up with my complicated mechanisms to stop gas fumes that just don't work. The only thing that didn't work is the anti-overfill feature. For me, that's not really a negative. For other it might be. I just wanted to make users aware that it might or might not work. Mine did not.
customer_reviews.author: TechDude

customer_reviews.title: BEST Gas Can I have used
customer_reviews.text: I have several steel cans I have had for 20 years, but I have to say I like these better. Like Johnny Bench said about Krylon: "No runs, no drips, no errors". Kinda makes me wish I could justify replacing all my steel cans at once....
customer_reviews.author: E. Shipman

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This gas can is awesome. No longer do you I have to struggle with those new hard to operate safety caps. I'm old school. While this does have safety features, it is easy to pour fuel into tools such as weed eaters and blowers, and of course the lawn mower. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Casteel

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. Quality Control Failure.
customer_reviews.text: Opened package today and the safety feature on the lid is threaded so tight that it's impossible to remove without cutting away the tab that holds it in place. Unfortunately, this item is NON-RETURNABLE and, because it is "sold by Amazon", it's impossible to get in touch with a human being to explain the issue.
customer_reviews.author: TONY

customer_reviews.title: easy and safe to use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent push button spout for controlled dispensing of gasoline for my mower. Only dislike was the black locking teeth when you have to take the cap off to have it filled, I cut that locking teeth out, and problem with it since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the right gas can!
customer_reviews.text: This can is perfect. It's available in several sizes - the first one I bought was a 5-gallon can and I love it too. You really can gas your mower without spilling a drop. It seals so well that the plastic cap on the end is only needed if you want to keep dust out between uses.
customer_reviews.author: MrKen

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: No-Spill 1415 1-1/4 gallon poly gas can is everything I was looking for. The plastic is thicker than some of my previous gas cans. I was fed up with trying to pour a small amount of gas into my string trimmer, hold the twist/push lock and not overfill/spill. The push button dispense is marvelous. Not a drop spilled. I love how easily I can fill my string trimmer in a controlled manner. Love this gas can.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I hate almost all the gimmick no spill cans that spill gas everywhere and I have tried most of them. This works EXACTLY like the video. We even filled a shot glass like in the commercial and dang if it doesn't work perfectly. If the spout holds up for an extended time I will buy 19 of these things. So far so great. Wife can fill up the lawnmower on her own for the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Fill your tank with out looking and not spill a drop!
customer_reviews.text: This can is being used to feed my snowblower. The lip on the spout makes it easy to hold the spout steady, and it does turn off, just like in the video! Really cool idea that actually works. The locking tab on the black screw on piece is a little stiff. It might just find itself being cut off, or just ignored.
customer_reviews.author: Coat buying husband

customer_reviews.title: That No-Spill Spout Changes Things
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at paying the price for this gas can but I let the overall rating sway my decision. I love the no spill spout. It's easy to use and works perfectly. I would take this over any other safety can that I have used to date.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: My favorite dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has the easy dispense trigger, but I wish it would have a handle on the rear so I could hold it up easier. The extra space is also nice for mixing gas, but I wish the one gallon line was clearly marked.
customer_reviews.author: Kamden

customer_reviews.title: When purchased on sale they are a great no spill container.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a couple 1 1/4 gallon containers on discount for $13.99 each. They are great at minimizing spillage. I have other larger cans that are over 3 years old and all work fine even after accidentally leaving it out in the sun and having the gas vapors expand some. The normal pricing is a little high but I'd still recommend them since they don't fail like the others I've had.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: but it's great being able to control how fast the gas flows ...
customer_reviews.text: The auto-stop doesn't work quite as wel as you'd expect (the nozzle needs to be well below where you want the gas to stop). But everything else about this can has been exactly what I wanted. It has a low center of gravity so it doesn't want to tip over when being transported. Sure, it requires two hands to pour, but it's great being able to control how fast the gas flows with the button.
customer_reviews.author: OBSSD

customer_reviews.title: Drip by Drip
customer_reviews.text: Specifically for my small 50cc scooter with a one-gallon tank that isn't easily filled at a service station. This small gas can dispenses into the tank in a controlled way. A perfect solution for my small scooter needs.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Folk

customer_reviews.title: Still the best.
customer_reviews.text: Top notch. I have been using this brand for years. I like this can in particular because the outlet is small enough to fit into the small inlet in my string trimmer...so I no longer need a funnel for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Backpackable, does not leak!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gas container and it does not leak. I carry it on long dirt bike rides in wilderness conditions in backpack where you do not want leaking gasoline getting into everything! Only thing I do not like is the shark tooth ratchet mechanism that makes sure it stays tight. It is challenging to back it off, surely there is a way to get the job done more easily.
customer_reviews.author: msd

customer_reviews.title: this brother is a garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't spend money on this product I got yesterday I used it today and the two machines were exceeded gasoline
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas can...EVER! Safe, easy to dispense and store. No leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Best gas cans on the market.. hands down for me! I love the design, the nozzle, the comfort, the safety. All quality materials, I wouldn't buy another brand...ever. So worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Logan E

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Hate the new carb compliant stuff but this one is almost as good as the old types of gas cans. It pours fairly quickly and does not leak all over the place like all the other so call carb compliant cans. As a real bonus there is no smell from the can at all. You can put it inside the vehicle and carry it around for awhile and guess what - you won't pass out from the fumes. The button is a bit of a hard push but not too bad for my older arthritic hands. All in all a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: just john

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an awesome gas can. The poly material makes it light but yet very durable. Nice color and the spill proof spout is super addition that sets this can apart from the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Tyzuki

customer_reviews.title: No spill, No overfill, No juggling act.
customer_reviews.text: No spill, no overfill of chain saws or other small power tools because the cut off is precise and gallon mark takes the guesswork out of getting correct oil and gas mixtures for 2 cycle engines. Added to that the fixed correct angle of the spout gets rid of the juggling act of trying to hold a flexible spout in place while tilting the container to the drain the gas. Charles Leach
customer_reviews.author: Cl

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints.. very agreeable CARB compliant can...
customer_reviews.text: I like this can.... no spill means no spill... I use it to mix 2 stroke gas and oil and the sight level in the side really works well for that. I also use it transfer from the 5 gallon can to this can then into the lawn tractor... much more convenient and easy to handle when filling the Deere... The safety "valve" works well with a 2 finger pull... I've heard a lot of people complain about CARB compliant cans, but seriously no complaints with this one. I'm very happy with this can, it works quite well
customer_reviews.author: FoxHillSpeedShop

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Best gas can that I have ever used. Gradations on the side make it very easy to see how much fuel is in the can. Doesn't leak like all the other cheap competitors, even when left in the bed of my truck. Very easy to cleanly fill tanks on small engines without spilling. Definitely worth the extra cost. I just bought another one for mixed fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Evan C

customer_reviews.title: Really like the pushbutton concept
customer_reviews.text: The no-spill button worked perfectly - with the gas can in the van, couldn't even smell the gas over an extended trip! "Can" is thick plastic; feels and performs like a high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hanson

product_meta.title: No-Spill 1415 1-1/4-Gallon Poly Gas Can (CARB Compliant)
product_meta.description: Most spills occur tipping a normal can to get the spout into the tank opening before the liquid comes out, or removing the spout from the target vessel before overflowing. The No-Spill spout is fully user controlled so you tip the can vertical, insert the spout into the vessel opening, then press the button to begin and control pouring. To stop pouring simply release the button. Practically eliminates spills and overflows. The only Spill-Proof spout with thumb button control that does not push down on your tank's filler neck to pour. More control, fewer tip-overs of your small equipment. The fastest pouring Spill-Proof nozzle available. At up to 3 gal/min, compare to other brands at 1.5 to 2.0 gal/min. Meets California Air Resources Board requirements for sale or use in California. Autostop removable nozzle, single opening for filling & pouring, treated can body for low permeation. The most user friendly CARB compliant can available. Easily fills even the smallest equipment without the need to press down on the tank opening. 6-inch Flex Spout Extension (sold separately) allows filling of on-road vehicles, boats and many other hard to reach tank openings. No-Spill Gasoline cans are tested and certified to ASTM F-85299 Standard Specification for Portable Gasoline Containers for Consumer Use and our Diesel & Kerosene cans are tested and certified to ASTM F-97602 Standard Specification for Portable Kerosene and Diesel Containers for Consumer Use.
feature_bullets: Thumb button control for precise pouring
7/8-inch funnel spout fills even the smallest equipment
Attached dust cover keeps your spout clean
